page.title: 10Trimley St.Mary Church-Plans
page.content: People driving past are very surprised to see that Trimley has two churches in the same churchyard. Trimley St. Martin used to have its own rector and services were held in both churches at the same time. Now one rector looks after both villages and services are held in each church on alternate weeks. The congregation has to pay to keep two churches open. There is no church hall and sometimes the churches are not big enough to hold everyone. The Rector showed us some plans which will solve these problems. St.Martin's church will be made a little bigger and St.Mary's will be divided up,making the vestry into a meeting room, the chancel into a chapel,the nave into a hall and the tower into a kitchen. The Rector says that churches have often been altered in the past.People should not object.
